title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: This interview was with the UGFTV Program at NYU 1) I did not receive any preparation questions in advance, but that is not unusual. 2) The questions felt as if they were trying to trip me up rather than to get to know me and have a constructive conversation. The overall atmosphere was hostile. 3) Although the questions were scripted for this first interview, with each committee member asking me one question, one of the committee members phrased their question in an overtly ageist manner, upsetting the remainder of the interview for me. I actually reported this faculty member, something I have never felt compelled to do before after an interview.

The recruiter also accused the summary of my extensive background and projects as "fluff" which was offensive. Despite his tone on the phone and other indicators that he wouldn't move me forward, he still waited 2 weeks before sending the rejection email. I'm no longer interested in any jobs at this institution, after this experience.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Slow and unresponsive. First interview with HR representative. Then three more interviews with the Staff at the Berkley Center for Entrepreneurship, no more than 30 minutes. Another check in with HR after those 3 conversations. Everything seemed normal during that 3 week period, but then there was basically silence for 2.5 months. One follow up response was "we'll get back to you soon" and never heard back from that person. Other people just never answered. After 2 months I finally heard there was an unexpected pause (thanks for letting me know). And then finally I get a generic email response from an unknown NYU email saying I was not selected. I think my first conversation for this job was mid-June and I got that last email mid-September. Such a poor representation of NYU and a center which represents entrepreneurship.
Interview Questions: Typical questions on why I'm interested, what I've accomplished, tell me about yourself.

What the level of your under class?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions:
Three rounds:

1) Interview with admissions officers and future coworkers. They asked all your standard questions and then there was a role-play scenario. Everyone was extremely kind.
2) Interview with Associate Director and Senior Admissions Officer. They were also very nice! They asked a lot about my experience and prompted another role-play scenario.
3) Meeting with Director. I wasn't selected for this, but it would've been the next step in the process.

It was an overall pleasant experience! The one thing I will say is that the interviewers in round two absolutely led me to believe that I would be called back for another round, even though I was not selected. 

I have always been good at "picking up the vibes" and predicting the outcomes of my interviews and I was a little surprised that they didn't call me back. I think they are just very nice people who treat all applicants with respect.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a basic phone screening with HR that lasted about 20 minutes. A week later I get invited to a second interview with the department manager, but the name of the job changed. It went from “Systems Administrator” to “Junior Systems Administrator.” No big deal, but that was a weird thing. He then opens the interview by saying he didn’t read my resume and asks me questions he knew I wouldn’t know the answer to if he had just read my resume. Then he formally introduces himself 15 minutes into the interview along with the duties of his department. Somehow, I make it to the third interview (manager took a 2 week vacation between second and third interview) and the third interview is a panel presentation for him and 6 other colleagues. The presentation goes fine, but almost the entire panel looked disinterested. The manager asks the panel if they have any questions for me, and it’s clear as day no one prepared any interview questions as only 2 of the 6 panelists asked me any questions at all and only one of the questions had anything to do with the position. I answered a total of 3 or 4 questions, and when the manager would keep asking if anyone else had any questions, silence would prevail for 10-20 seconds. To top it off, I didn’t even get a rejection until I reached out to the hiring manager. Completely unprofessional interview process, especially considering it took so long between interviews.
Interview Questions: What is a pivot table?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Enjoyable process. 3 rounds of interviews with various team members. Be prepared for a panel round of interviews on the last round, more formal. Overall the process took 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions typical of role.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Different units within the university have different HR points of contact, FYI, so this might not be indicative of the entire university... but for anonymity's sake, I won't name the specific division.

I applied to this role about a month before receiving a request to interview from HR. The initial phone screen with HR was very standard - nothing unexpected or out of the ordinary. 

From there, things got a bit weird. I was invited to move on to the next round (a Zoom call with the hiring manager) but was told that they wanted to move quickly, so they asked for my availability that same week. I told them I couldn't do that and needed to push it to the following week. They agreed and the call was also one that was pretty expected - nothing out of the ordinary. The HM mentioned that that was the first of three rounds with the team not counting the HR rep.

After that way, I was invited to move on to the third round, but they again pressed that they wanted to do it that same week - within days of the original - and that it would include a presentation. I pushed back to try and delay to the following week so that I had time to prepare but they pushed back, as well, and we ended up doing it on Friday (the previous round was on that Monday). 

After the panel interview/presentation, HR scheduled a follow up call in which I asked what the third round would entail. They were confused, so I explained what the HM had said. She said that she would get back to me with clarification but never did. I followed up a week later and didn't receive a reply, so I followed up again the following week and was told after a few more days that they had decided to promote someone internally. It seemed a bit weird to me that HR and the hiring team didn't appear to be on the same page about what the process entailed...
Interview Questions: From the research you've done about the team, what has surprised you the most about us?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Awkward, rushed, disorganized. Communication before and after the interview was horrible. Definitely left a bad taste in my mouth. If this is how they treat someone that they might be interested in, how do they treat staff?
Interview Questions: Basic history, strengths, weaknesses - didn't feel exceptionally well thought out.

Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and interesting interview process. I found the interviewer to be very approachable and organised. It was roughly 20 minutes long. I found it very beneficial and learnt a great deal from it.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Technical Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Super relaxed questions just about who you are, more to gauge the type of person you are, just a single interview and the hiring was determined soon after that. Had a great chat.
Interview Questions:
Whats an obstacle you've overcome? 
Tell me about yourself and why you are interested in this job?

title: Public Health Ambassador Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple and efficient. The questions were not very difficult but prompted thinking about public health in New York City. The graduate coordinators were very professional and welcomed questions. They were not intimidating and I was very excited to start working in this role.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in promoting our campus's public health?

title: Network Operations Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: Overall, a great and informative  interview process. I was impressed with the interviewers and the high level of customer service provided. They got back to me right away when I has questions. The whole process was not easy but what I appreciated the most was how highly organized and smooth it went for each stage. I truly enjoyed the interviewing with all parties. I had a three step process and two assignments. In the end I didn't get an offer because the position was taken down, and more than one of the interviewers follow up to explain the situation and provided valuable feedback.
Interview Questions: What do you find to be the most prevalent inequities in education today?

title: Research Scientist Interview

Staff who interviewed me were highly-reputable professors. They were very friendly and respectful throughout the whole interview process.

Staff who interviewed me were highly-reputable professors. They were very friendly and respectful throughout the whole interview process.

Interview Descriptions: One recruiter call, brought to campus and got all interviews done with on the same day. I was offered the position the same day, and started on Monday after an offer on a Friday. I don't believe this was typical, but the process moved very, very fast for me.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: What are you doing now?

This is my experience pre-COVID:
1. Call from hiring manager to set up interview
2. First in-person interview with a panel
3. Second in-person interview: include presentation assignment and interview with leadership in the department
4. Next day got call for an offer contingent on references.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

topics that interest the most

title: NYU Press - Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty standard. I applied online,  had a quick phone call with an HR person, and then multiple rounds of interviews.  The actual process was fine, but their follow up was really bad. I ended up getting a job offer elsewhere a day after my third in person interview at NYU Press. I told the HR team that I had an offer pending and wanted to see if they were still interested in me. They never responded, and I found this to be very unprofessional considering I came to their offices on three different occasions for over an hour each time. I do not plan on applying to NYU Press again and I wouldn't recommend to colleagues.
Interview Questions: standard questions about publishing

The interview was really conversational, felt really comfortable and easy going. title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and a month later the hiring manager called me to schedule an interview.  I was taken by surprised because most people would shoot an email first.  I went in for an in person interview and the hiring manager was very kind and friendly.  Then I was offer a second interview a week later with a faculty member.  She was also very friendly and welcoming.  I thought both interview went well, but radio silence since the last interview.  I wish NYU would at least let their candidates know they are no longer in the running after having two in-person interview.

“Describe a time you overcame a challenge in your research?”

title: Endpoint Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The initial contact and phone call went well. My issue was when I went to follow up with the interviewer (who stated on the call they would contact me a week later with updates). I did follow up a couple week's later asking about our interview last week and if he had any feedback. His response: 

"Thanks for your note.  My feedback for you is that your time management skills need work.  Our interview was not last week it was three weeks ago."

Pretty rude to be sending that to an external applicants especially if you as an interviewer said you would contact me a week later after it has been over three weeks like you stated above.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 2 weeks with extra “assignments” we had to complete. There were multiple steps to the process and it was more like a camp to school you in a taste of how the job would be.
Interview Questions: How would you balance this job with your school life?

title: Junior Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
After a 10-minute phone screening & a writing test, I didn't get any updates despite following up twice. 

Almost 3 weeks later, I received a computer-generated, grammatically incorrect email from the HR department, informing me that I had not been selected. There was no way for me to ask for feedback. In fact, I don't even know if my test was ever read by anyone. 

The whole communication process could be and should be improved.
Interview Questions: Generic questions like why do you want to work for NYU,  what kind of experience did you have that's relevant to the position, etc.

title: Space Management Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. They ask you a couple questions and then will either schedule a sort of test that day or call you back in. The test is pretty simple, and reflects what you'll be doing most days.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with AutoCAD?

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview process involving a phone screen and multiple in-person interviews. Everyone I met with was kind and the interviews were conversational. I was asked several behavioral interviews and some difficult questions from HR.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you experienced and resolved conflict?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Based on merit, only for current students though. General Question about the preference of teaching and timetable. Anded offered the position immediately after the interview. Recommended for all students enrolled in NYU to take on tutoring jobs.
Interview Questions: Based on Mathematical Background and Merit

title: Research/Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screener was very helpful in understanding the role and responsibilities. Interviewers were very knowledgeable in the field and asked thorough and thoughtful questions. Very open to a dialogue vs. purely Q &A session
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your previous position

title: Administrative Aide II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went through a series of in person interviews (pre pandemic) over the course of about 2 months and did not receive an offer in the end because they decided to hire an alumni over me. The entire process took about 4 months from the application.
Interview Questions: How would you best describe your organizational skills and interpersonal skills?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly casual as I was hired through the pool of recent graduates of the same program I would teach. The required skillset is judged thoroughly, though. Luckily there was a great attitude from the interviewer that allowed me to get the position.
Interview Questions: I was given an option to teach one two undergraduate classes, based on my skill set and proven experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied via their posting on CareerBuilder

Initial phone screen 

Met with Lab Manager then the professors and grad students in the lab. Everyone was professional and pleasant. I made the top 5 candidates out of 200 applicants but ultimately the job went to an NYU student.
Interview Questions:
What are your future plans? 

How do you handle conflict?

title: Summer Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: They have you apply, then if selected, you come in for an interview. After, it depends on if you are a returnee or not, but you go in to speak to a Building Leadership Team member from a random hall and have a 1:1 conversation with them. Afterwards, you find out in two weeks. Sometimes the summer positions are extremely competitive, and I didn't get it the first time I tried. I got it the second two, though.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Shift Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was professional but personable.  No surprises. She also gave  options for other available jobs she thought I would be more suited for.  The phone interview was the same.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? Your weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic questions like what was in my supplementary and why did I choose to do engineering. Also asked some coding questions, most were easy.  Went through 2 rounds, first was a group interview and a 2 on 1 interview with the lab mentors.
Interview Questions: Why STEM?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and about two weeks later I had gotten an email requesting to come in for an interview. The interview went very positive in my opinion. I prepared a lot for it so there weren't any questions that threw me off. I interviewed with two staff members and the exchange was very positive with compliments on my answers, agreements and positive body language. It lasted about 30 minutes and I was told that I would be contacted in about four weeks as they hope to have the position filled in about four to six weeks. A thank you email was sent the next day. 

As four weeks passed I sent the interviewer an email to follow up and to reiterate my interest in working for NYU. Unfortunately, I did not receive a response. I waited two weeks and left the interviewer a voice mail to follow up again, and I never received a response to that. 

I am still giving this a positive interview experience, but to anyone who goes through the interview process, I am just giving a heads up to you that despite your best efforts you may not receive a response when you follow up.
Interview Questions:
What interests you about NYU?

Tell us about a difficult experience with a client/customer?

What are you looking for in a manager?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Internal hire through a department. Filled out an application and was informed 3-4 weeks later. Probably helped by being an undergraduate. Asked about teaching experience and coursework experience, why I wanted to join. Typical interview stuff
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The position was in the Global Institute for Advanced Study on their "future of work" project. Skype call with a professor in philosophy who apparently is quite famous in his field, but his work is so distant from my own that I had never heard of him. AFAIK, the 30 minute Skype appointment was the extent of the interview process for a 1-2 year postdoc. Questions felt like they were intended to figure out my intellectual prowess, virtually nothing about my CV or research skills.
Interview Questions: What do you think are the most important developments in your field as they relate to this project? Can you tell me about any literature on effective initiatives to improve job quality? What do you think the most promising policy interventions would be to address these challenges?

title: Research Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I did a quick Skype interview twice. I was casual and straightforward. The questions were all expected and I was rather surprised by how positive he/she was about my application. I felt like the interview was more of a confirmation process rather than screening. I honestly think it would really depend on which POI you are interviewing with. My employer was very casual.
Interview Questions: What is your research interests

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Called by recruiter. Met with three departmental managers. met with another recruiter.  The third interviewer was the most inapt individual I have ever had to deal with. Because of her I turned down the interview. This was not the first time I had experienced a horrible time with NYU HR. Even after being offered positions, the recruiter vigorously attempted to make things difficult for me. Perhaps it was because I was a male.  All my documents were constantly rejected. The process took weeks. My background an experience were questioned numerous times. Just the most disgusting illustration of competence. NYU needs to hire better recruiters who know what they are doing. They hire newbies who want to hire young minimally skilled candidates. They are not hiring based on years of experience.
Interview Questions: How do I handle stress?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a current employee.  The first step was the submission of my resume to the department head, followed by e-mail exchanges, an in-person interview,  and, finally,  submission of work samples.
Interview Questions: What would you syllabus for the course include?

title: Senior Marketing Associate / Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application where you told them about yourselves. After that, there was an online interview where you submitted 3-5 questions about yourself. Then there was a group interview with around 9 people where they gave you potential scenarios and you had to react to them.
Interview Questions: How you would react if a person rang the hotline complaining that their child was rejected

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through email after hearing that a position was empty for one of the classes. To apply to this position, you must have taken that class with a grade above B+. You need a recommendation letter from a professor from that department as well.
Interview Questions: Explain a  concept from your subject.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: First, there was an Online Programming round. After 15 days they have a telephonic call (HR). After 1 week they have a coding round at their workplace. They give you 3-4 questions in the first coding round. And then in the 2nd coding round they have Aptitude test, programming test and then a coding round (3-4) questions.
Interview Questions: Buyer seller problem. Calculate number of un-expired apples left after each buy

title: Academic Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Had a thoughtful and thorough screening interview.  The scheduling process and requests for references was well-organized and professional.   The recruiter gave useful and informative feedback about the suitability of the role following the interview
Interview Questions: What about this job do you think would be the most and least exciting?  What would you say is the biggest challenge you have faced in your current role?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Professor asked for some background into my previous research during undergrad and then asked if I was interested in his lab's current work. I told him about my thesis and experience with analyzing biological data and interest in continuing my research career.
Interview Questions: What skills did you acquire from your time during undergrad that you could use here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to set up an interview, had the interview a few days later by phone because I was out of town and was assured I would personally be notified if I was chosen to go on to the next round or not. It has been weeks and haven't yet received any communication either way, and no response to a polite inquiry. Didn't ask me many questions in the interview mostly told me about the job duties and what they were looking for, but didn't give me much room to respond.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your previous jobs and responsibilities
Have you had to deal with customers who are less than pleasant?

title: Laboratory Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: It's generally a two to three part process.   First you meet with the department's associate director  - she's amazing and kind.  but make sure you're on point and confident.  Then you'll meet with HR who's really there to make sure your employment transition is smooth.
Interview Questions: Talk to us about your experiences (in detail).

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email the following week to set up an in person interview. I met with an HR rep and an Associate Director of the school. The interview went very well. standard questions with no real curveballs. Both were very nice and made me feel comfortable. After that I never heard back. It took me emailing two weeks later to figure out what was going on. They responded with they enjoyed my interview, but decided on someone else. What irked me is that I had to reach out to the school to find out the decision. That is completely unacceptable. There is no reason to not hear back from a job you interview for. Liked the interview , but that ruined the whole experience.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from a manager or higher up?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: I am a perfect candidate but the interview process is computerized, non personal.  In short, unless a human is reading over my resume, I am getting passed by.  It is bias.  I wasn't given a fair chance and have more experience than the job dictates.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well...I found the questions to be a little condescending when there is a resume in front of them. The interviewers seemed very happy to work there. They had been there for years and pushed that they are looking for "lifers"
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Google Calendar and platform?

title: Legal Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I received an email advising that they wanted to bring me in to meet with two attorneys. They were friendly and informative. It took about three weeks for them to respond to me, and I reached out first. They willingly provided feedback on my interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about the work you do.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: i applied on career net and got an email to set up an interview. the interview went for about 30 minutes and it was a comfortable atmosphere. The interviewer made me feel less nervous.
Interview Questions: my office experience

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with one of the department administrators asking technical questions about how you would handle certain situations on the job such as trouble shooting errors and client confidentiality.
Interview Questions: If someone came in claiming that they have been locked out of their account and asked you to provide them with their password what were the steps you would take to help them?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: After sending a resume, they emailed me and called me in for an in person interview. The interview was fairly relaxed and focused mainly on my background and what I would offer to the lab
Interview Questions: Can you tell me a time where you had trouble working with someone in your team and how did you handle it?

title: Structural Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy and very nice no problems what so ever. Just be positive my G. Live strong live long. I follow you you follow me. Keep moving forward. Superhuman God AstroQueen. I will not lose
Interview Questions: Describe your resume

title: AV Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straight forward. Asked what your skills are and how do you usually solve problems. Some behavioral question and that's pretty much it. Don't really expect anything big from it.
Interview Questions:
How do you cope with employees who have attitude on you?
Do you support LGBT?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1. Meeting in person and with group members.
2. Presenting works you've done so far.
3. Ask and answer session for your expertise and experiences.
4. What you can contribute to the group creativity and environment.
Interview Questions: It depends on your expertise and experiences. You'd better get prepared with proper answers by searching the group website and research papers.

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I went to three rounds:
One with the HR rep. Then onto the specific department. Then I had to interview with the HR higher up. It was an overall very good experience. Thank you.
Interview Questions: Name one weakness and one strength.

title: Graduate Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straightforward. The department wanted to find out what type of experience I had with organization events and I had substantial experience. We discussed the type of events I had been part of and involved with and the role I took in those projects.
Interview Questions: Describe an event you worked on and what was your role?

title: Population Health Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying online and sending in my resume and cover letter, the organization's talent manager reached out to me via email for a phone interview.  The phone interview took place two days later and lasted less than 15 minutes.
Interview Questions:
How did I find this opportunity? 
Tell me about your most recent experience? 
Tell me about your data analysis skills? 
What salary would you request?
How soon will you be able to work? 
If we asked for proof of ability to work in the US, would you be able to provide it?
Are you in need of Visa sponsorship? 
Do you have any questions for me?

title: Field Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I completed a short phone interview. Then I was invited to an in person interview the next  day. I was interviewed by a group of 3 for the first part. The second half was done by the director.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Administrative Aide II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, but took 3 months before I found out a decision. Even after a reference check it took 1 month before I was told they had picked someone else, and was not even provided with a reason.
Interview Questions: Very standard questions. It's academia, so it's not that challenging.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call back after 1+ week to set up a phone interview. I was then invited for an in person interview with three people. They were all nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant environment. Behavioral Questions. Walked supervisors through my resume and the finished up the interview by taking a tour of our department. The supervisors were open to my questions and very transparent about what to expect on the job as far as time commitment and tasks the work required.
Interview Questions: Name a time you overcame a challenging work experience

title: Senior Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the Senior HR Generalist for a brief phone interview before being scheduled to meet with the  HR Senior Manager and HR Director. The interview was straight forward, no super challenging questions. I thought I had a nice rapport with both Managers and I expected to be contacted for a second interview. However, similar to other candidates, I did not receive any follow up at all. Even if I was not selected, it would have been nice for them to close the loop. The NYU HR Dept has always had a reputation for not following up.
Interview Questions: Describe the recruitment process at your last job? What was your involvement with performance management? Describe a time that you had to work with a difficult Manager and get their but in for an idea.

title: Computer IT Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: After sending my application by email, I was contacted for an interview. I found it refreshing that both the supervisor and work colleague I would be assisting shared their own stories .
Interview Questions: They asked about a detailed experience I had previously working as a consultant at a computer lab.

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received an email and phone call to set up interview the following week. Attended interview hosted by office managers and not HR. It was okay but not exactly what I was expecting.
Interview Questions: What management style in a supervisor do you prefer?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with staff of department are usually the norm when interviewing for NYU.  Some staff are younger and unqualified. It is all about the name of the degree you carry.
Interview Questions: The normal why NYU? Why are you wanting to leave your current position etc.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
2 phone interviews, 1 in person interview with 3 people.   HR called all three of my references, had extensive conversations with them, then made me an offer for the job.  I was thrilled.  I spoke with HR about benefits, then HR called again to ask me my current salary (now an illegal question) and what I contribute to my 401K at my present job!  I was floored. 
  But this was my dream job, and I was going to accept it.  They told me an offer letter would come that afternoon.   Except it didn't.  Instead, HR called the next morning they told me they made an offer to someone else.  I could not believe my ears.   We even had a start date.  Thank GOD I did not give notice at my present job.    It was the worst and most unprofessional process I have ever experienced.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to commute to nyc?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I showed up during the scheduled time. I had two interviewers. We then went over several simple calculus problems.  We then discussed the program and the students with another person.
Interview Questions: Give an explanation and several examples of the chain rule.

title: SPACE Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got invited to take an interview at the workplace. It was pretty basic. Just questions about what I was interested in and skills.  I also had to take a test regarding AutoCAD. It was to make sure you could follow directions. Required minimal knowledge of autoCAD.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to get out of this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Only Resume submission, people are evaluated on the job. You won't be hired next semester if you do not do a satisfactory job. Great place to work, hours are relaxed for incoming assistants and supervisors are supportive.
Interview Questions: Previous relevant experience

title: Program Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: 5 interviews in less than three weeks. Incredibly intensive, met with a lot of people in rapid succession to make sure someone was in place by the start of the fall. The questions were intensive but all within the scope of the role. I think the hardest part was interviews within units and then with HR that seemed disconnected from the unit itself.
Interview Questions: What programs would you create to best support identity based student groups?

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview. Took 3 weeks altogether.  1st step was over the phone and it lasted 10 minutes. Seconf=d was a panel interview and last was a meeting with CEO.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest thing you ever had to do?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Interview went wel just prepared to answer along questions based on your resume and what if scenarios. NYU seems like a great place to work and the lady that interview me was awesome.
Interview Questions: What would you do different if your current position??

title: Program Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very intensive process overall. There were several interviews both on the phone and in person. It included a presentation and meeting with several staff members. It could be intimidating so and challenging so it is definitely necessary to do a lot of preparation.
Interview Questions: Explain a major project or event that you have worked on and how did you make it successful?

title: Phonathon Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was essentially a group interview. They want to verify you'll garner donations and not freak out if callers curse at you or call you out. Just stay calm and stick to the script.
Interview Questions: What if someone tries to rush you off the phone, how would you handle that?

title: Digital Labs Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was over skype because I was out of state and they were hiring for the fall semester. Really chill, and basic interview questions, asks about knowledge of programs, fabrication equipment, etc.
Interview Questions: Which programs do you know how to use

title: NYU Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position, less than one week two professors from the electrical and computer engineering department called me and asked me a few questions about my background, skills and theoretical knowledge.
Interview Questions: How do you fit in this position?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a call back the week after to schedule a phone interview. The interview itself was generic, but the experience also felt detached. Pretty much asked for an overview of all my experience from oldest to newest.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working in this specific department?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call that day. We scheduled an interview the next day but the hiring manager called last minute to push the interview back a week. The following week I received a call and the interview was pretty straight forward. I wasn't asked about any of my past experience, just generic interview questions. I was told there were more people to interview and I would hear back either way. I knew with that response that I probably didn't get it. I got an email a week later saying they found someone else.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in NYU and in this position?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Dropped CV on the portal. Received an interview call. The interviewer was not really interested, so asked another employee to interview me, and asked me relevant questions and I received an offer in the end.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: First received a phone call after a few days of submitting an online application. They then asked me to come into the office so I had to fly in on a Sunday for a Monday interview. Met with HR first and they then showed me around to other departments that had similar openings. I then got called back for a second in person interview, third interview in total where I met with an executive. They then called me back about references and would let me know about their decision pending the results from the references.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your organizational skills?

title: Multimedia Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was late for the interview and seemed not have read my CV. Also, she didn't have much idea about the role and therefore was unable to ask pertinent questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Summer RA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with 2 residence hall directors. They each asked about 7 questions, ranging from behavior and personality to what I would do in a certain situation. They were very nice. Even though they asked questions, it was very conversational and led by the interviewee.
Interview Questions: How would you work to build a strong community with your residents and fellow co-workers?

title: Technologist (IT) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions:
The process consisted of two phone screens with an outside recruiter (since I applied through an agency), a lengthy online application plus resume and cover letter, a phone interview with the prospective manager and one other member of the team, and two rounds of multiple in-person interviews.

On the positive side, everyone I talked to/met with was friendly. It seemed like a collegial environment.

On the negative side, some things to look out for:
- The online application requires you to state a numeric salary expectation. It also involves re-typing most of what's in your resume (and some other things, like the high school you attended!). Expect to spend several hours on it in addition to whatever time you spend crafting your cover letter and resume.
- Before each phone or in-person interview, the NYU recruiter would send me an email listing the names of everyone who would be involved in the interview. This never ended up matching reality: for the phone interview, one person was a no-show, and for each in-person interview 4+ additional people showed up who were not listed on the email and who seemed to be looking at my resume for the first time. This is obviously the hiring team's prerogative, and will give you a sense of whether you enjoy working in a consensus-driven environment, but it's something to be prepared for (both mentally and logistically, e.g., print lots of extra resumes).
- Despite the technical profile of the role, I was surprised at how non-technical the interviews were (no whiteboard coding or anything). I couldn't tell if this was typical or if it was specific to my candidacy.
Interview Questions: Lots of behavioral stuff--be ready with some specific anecdotes about navigating bureaucracy, taking ownership of projects in a very hierarchical environment, influencing without authority, dealing with fire drills, etc.
