title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a typical academic interview: give a seminar on your research work, take questions, and spend the day talking with the faculty in one to one meetings. Given that my research topic was slightly out of the main interests of most people, I got softball questions in the seminar. Some of the one on ones were more probing
Interview Questions: What will you be working on in 5 years

title: Financial Analyst Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Simple, but very competitive. The application was open for 3 days, and there were already 50 people for one position. Behavioral questions. Show that you are personable. And tell them why you want to work there. Just be yourself :)
Interview Questions: What experience did you have that will help you here?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied via NYU CareerNet. Once I received an email response, I set an interview date and met with the interviewer at her office. Great interview, simple, general questions. After that I had another interview with the people I would be working directly with. They also gave me some things to work on to test my abilities.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your old job?

title: Box Office Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was called pretty soon after I applied. The box office manager interviewed me and it was very chill. As a student worker, they were very understandable about lack of experience.
Interview Questions: How long have you been working in customer service?

title: ITS Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Asked a lot about team work, problem solving, and customer service experience. You can go in with you casual clothes. It was very easy going. The managers were nice and friendly. Just be honest and short.
Interview Questions: customer service

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: It's easy. Just be confident. But first you need have a great GPA and resume. The questions are basic and mostly related to your courses and projects. Also there are some behavioral questions you need to talk about.
Interview Questions: Describe a project in which you had a conflict with your team members and how you solved that?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Given a small SDN project. Asked to finish in certain time. The project is about to program RYU controller to realize certain function. A report is required to submit as long as the code.
Interview Questions: What is SDN and Openflow?

title: Administrative Aide II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: As I was abroad when I first applied, my first interview was a Skype interview. It went really well and when I was back in the US I was asked to come for an in person interview which was a two hour session involving meeting with HR, three separate interviews with various staff members, and then a writing sample.
Interview Questions: One thing they asked me about was to describe different situations I had handled at past positions which involved angry or frustrated/persistent parties (here students) and how I dealt with that.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Brooklyn, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Personal interview might or might not be held. Applications are taken, reviewed and employees are selected subsequently. One might have to take a small, easy course on Lab Safety if they are working in a lab.
Interview Questions: They do ask for a semester-long commitment

title: GA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Go to see the professor and see what you can do and what you want to do, they want very motivated student and researchers, so you need to be showing that quality
Interview Questions: Are you familiar to some field

title: IT Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with the IT team and the future supervisor. Friendly atmosphere,  easy technical questions. How would you recover data, how would you protect it, what is dns - the basics. Phone interview first, then meeting with the tech team, then with supervisors. Two 1:1 interviews in all. A very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Basic technical topics

title: CPP TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: it's a long and interesting process. It was about 2-3 hrs without a break. All the concepts were asked in the interview. Overall nice experience. Preparing from the lecture notes and doing the rectitatiins will help a lot. There is no hard time limits but accuracy is a must. Got to have good communication skills and body language . This job in lives teaching so better be good with all the concepts
Interview Questions: All the basics of cpp

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Brooklyn, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: About a 3 hour interview focusing on C++ basics and strong Object oriented programming knowledge.  I was also tested for good communication and language skills. The interview also involved a coding quiz related to data structures.
Interview Questions: Basics of C++

title: Data Migration Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short and straight to the point. I was asked to talk about myself and my working experience. Then we reviewed my resume and began to go in depth on particular areas.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with cloud based data migration?

title: PC Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straight forward interview. All parties involved were very professional and asked the right questions. Very down to earth people also. HR also were very professional. Simple and straight forward interview. All parties involved were very professional and asked the right questions. Very down to earth people also. HR also were very professional.
Interview Questions: Hardest IT issue you have encountered and how you solved it.

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There are three stages of the interview process: initial phone screening, first round of interviews, and second round of interview. The initial phone screening with HR rep was unnecessarily hostile and discouraging (since the HR rep knows nothing about the actual nature of the work). The first and second round of interviews were much more open and comfortable.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied through NYU Careers, and about a week or so later received a call from the HR Department of the office I applied for. They assisted in setting up a Phone interview (as I was out of town). I then went through 2 rounds of Phone interviews (with different personnel within the office). I was asked to come in for an in person interview of which there were two separate short interviews (again with different people each time) and then was offered the position a couple of days later.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your organizational and prioritizing skills? Furthermore, what specific things do you do to stay organized and able to handle multiple projects at once?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Just ask something about your background and browse the resume. No technical questions. Since it is not a technical position, it just took me a few day to get the offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Stewardship Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a phone interview with a representative in HR. The representative was very cold and seemed skeptical of my credentials despite the valid experience I had in the field. It took about 30 minutes and afterwards, she said to email her some stewardship writing samples. I never heard back, but checked the website and it said that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: Have you personally written communications with any donors?

title: Program Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews before an offer was made. Each interview lasted about 30 - 45 minutes. My current supervisor was contacted prior to an offer being made. The salary offered was not competitive and I was told that, as an internal candidate, the salary offered could not be higher than my current salary.
Interview Questions: What's your management style like? What's one initiative you implemented?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
It was a three-week process (after they first contacted me):

1. Phone interview (15min) - basic questions about my resume and job description
2. In person interview (30 min) - in-depth questions about my resume, previous experiences, work style
3. Project Submission - in order to demonstrate my skills for the job

I applied online and got contacted within two weeks.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Weaknesses. 
Strengths. 
Why should we hire you? 
Tell me about a time in which you had an issue with a manager and how did you solve it?
Describe your project management habits/skills
What would be your dream job environment
Do you prefer to work with larger or smaller teams?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Email and then 1 phone call. The hiring coordinator reached out to me and we discussed which times were most suitable. It appeared that they had many applicants. I had a pleasant experience with whom I spoke with.
Interview Questions: Describe your biggest accomplishment at your recent place of employment

title: Information Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for this job on NYU Careernet portal. After 10-12 days i got email for in person interview. 
It is a panel interview. They basically ask the question based on Resume and my academic projects.
They give me one database task that i have to perform in a paper.
Interview Questions: Database Question. Draw ER diagram.

title: Project Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: very quick and good, but they lie in the interview. they will avoid telling you things about the position so you can't really make a good decision to take it or not. It was an easy interview cause the job was bad and no one wanted it.
Interview Questions: can you teach well. are you good at saying no?

title: Digital Studio Technology Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly simply and straightforward. The interviewer asked questions pertaining to my capabilities and experience with software programs and customer service. They wanted to know whether I understood the adobe creative suite, the mac operating system, and whether I could handle unruly clients. Overall, it was a positive experience and not stressful.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with an unsatisfied client

title: Career Development Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was contacted by the hiring team a few days later for a phone interview. They were professional and overall pleasant people. The phone interview was with the associate and senior assistant directors and took about twenty minutes. They asked some hypothetical situations and about overall work style. I was invited for an onsite interview with the rest of the team. The questions were not very difficult but not all of them seemed engaged. There were a lot more hypothetical questions the second time around. About a month later I was contacted and told that I would not be moving forward.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who has not held a job or internship throughout college and is expressing frustration at not getting a job?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well. It was not difficult. They asked some questions about my work and provided background about the position and the department. There were two people who interviewed me.
Interview Questions:
What is your work history?
Tell me about yourself
Why are you interested in the position?
What do you think you can bring to the position?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was lucky and didn't have to go through HR. My interview was with two administrative supervisors in the advertised program who were both very knowledgable in what the position would entail. The interview was very conversational, none of the canned HR questions about my greatest weakness, etc. It probably lasted about 20 minutes, and didn't involve any computer tests. I didn't get the job, but it was still a positive experience. From what I'm reading here, it seems to vary greatly depending on the department you are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What occurrences do you find most frustrating in daily office work?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Office Manager and the Secretary for a first round interview where I talked about myself and took a written test and for a second round interview I met with to members of the office in a more casual environment.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in the job

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Cambridge, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The fellowship was in Urban Policy, Urban Systems, and Urban Informatics. This was a 35 minute phone interview with one of the library deans and several librarians (the direct reports for the position).  The several interviewers were in the same room and had me on speakerphone.  After describing the position, they asked me about 7 or 8 questions about my qualifications, personal work strengths and weaknesses, research history, and then asked me if I had any questions.  The interview went very well, but I was told by email a week later that I did not receive the position because the opening was cancelled.
Interview Questions: What do you see being particular challenges of this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied directly to the professor assigned for the course. Emailed him and he replied to schedule an interview. During interview he asked me about my experience with the course and how it can be made better. Then was asked specific questions regarding python (loops, case statements etc).
Interview Questions: python technical questions

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Go over the resume, and ask reasons about choose this project. 
WHat is your major interests regarding to sociology and how do you think of this project.
Some basic research methods and program language problem.
Also how long will you devoted to this project.
Interview Questions: Why change career path to sociology, like poverty problem?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I'm in the beginning process of interviews. Had an interview with human resources. It was a great interview very relaxed, it was like chatting with a friend.The interview was over an hour and a half. I was then sent an online computer skill test from Proveit. I've passed the test and now waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Why NYU?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Brooklyn, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: descriptive interview with multiple people: would-be supervisor, HR rep and two department employees.  interview lasted roughly an hour.  a lot of their administrative jobs are via a temp agency.  I was employed by the temp agency and was interviewing to be placed at NYU.  I was told that most contracted individuals are hired a few months in.  I was hired a bit quicker because the needs of my employment were to access financial records that only an NYU employee could attain.  I was only a temp at NYU for approximately one month -  a week of which was paperwork that was performed in order to hire me in.  once the decision was made to hire me in, I did a phone interview with my supervisor and an HR representative (after applying for the job online).
Interview Questions: How my degree is applicable to my sought-after position

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I first got a phone interview, which went well. The interviewer said exactly how long it was going to take, and her expectations about the interview – what she wanted to achieve.
Then, I was invited to a personal interview. This time, the first interviewer was with the director of the center, who was less friendly. I perceived from the first moment she didn't like me. Maybe I'm wrong, but there was that impression.
Interview Questions: "If you were to be in a work team here, what would you bring to the table?"

title: Senior Fellow International Law Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Sweden Center, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Excellent , personal, direct, very comfortable. The panel was nice and open minded. They asked question in a freindly manner giving you absolute confidence. Questions were logic and straight to the Point. The chair if the panel took several mintes to opwn the interview and explain the whole idea about it.
Interview Questions:
Research Areas
How to apply experience in the UNiversity

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: first phone interview conducted by hr department and an onsite interview with 3round and an entire day.... Interview is average difficulties. Basic asking the data science questions and machine learning algorithms
Interview Questions: basic machine leaning questions

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: You meet with a professor. They ask you questions about your background. You tell them about your background. They hire you. There is nothing more to it. You just need to be yourself and be qualified for the class you are TAing for.
Interview Questions: What is your background?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a discussion with the administration after an e-mail conversation. It was mostly done without the employee being present and then confirmed through references. Being admitted for the position mostly required past experience in adjunct instructorship or other teaching equivalent to that in an institution that has equivalent status to New York University or at New York University directly.
Interview Questions: Have you taught any classes before and which ones have you taught at New York University?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Made me sit in some corner until hiring manager picked me up. Spent 3 minutes with me, and then accompanied me to another guy who was supposed to be some sort of senior in IT (he was a kid almost half my age). Kid bombarded me with all kind of NYU real-life scenarios that naturally I wasn't familiar with, followed by the question "so tell me, what would you have done?". Process lasted about one hour. Never heard back a single word from NYU.
Interview Questions: What would you have done if you had worked here?

title: Administrative Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: I always admired nyu so I applied few jobs that I am clearly qualified or even over-qualified for just so I can work for them. Unfortunately, it takes really long to hear back! Sometime maybe never! Went thru phone interview then in person but immediately another person filled the position ! What the .. Why waste my time !?!?  One time I applied for a dept within 5 days of posting date and 5 day later I checked online and I see "position filled" if you guy going to hired within, why even bother wasting out time !?!? Unbelievable.
Interview Questions: Explain your work history

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first met with the principal investigator, she pushed HR every day in order to get me to start working there as soon as possible. Unfortunately Hr takes a very long time getting back to people. I waited around 2-3 months until I was officially hired.
Interview Questions: What kind of lab experience do I have

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview was ok very informative but misleading.You will be lead on to think you are getting the job to later find out you are not although you are very qualified for the position.Very unprofessional. Dont always get your hopes up.
Interview Questions: they will ask questions based off your resume

title: Chief of Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I began the interview process by having a short phone screener with an HR recruiter. He was generally knowledgeable, but didn't have many specifics about the role. From there, I spoke with the outgoing Chief of Staff and then with several direct reports of the executive who I'd be staffing as Chief of Staff. I found the experience of interviewing with the direct reports to be a bit disorganized; their questions were a bit disconnected from the role and one of the reports appeared to be both tired and a bit bored.
Interview Questions: They talked about whether I'd feel comfortable in a Chief of Staff role where I'd have less autonomy and management responsibility than in my previous position. It was a good question.

title: Graduate Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a senior member at the Office of Global Services after I was submitted my application via NYU's CareerNet site. We discussed my resume and past experience and what about the Office of Global Services attracted my attention. The bulk of the interview was dedicated to determining my ability to fulfill responsibilities required of me at the OGS office.
Interview Questions: Can you handle a busy environment assisting students, answering phones and performing other tasks?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They asked about the undergraduate background, graduate courses, future career plans. They also asked why you applied for this i.e., what interested you in applying here? They asked why you will be a good fit for this organization?
Interview Questions: What is your backgroung?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Met with the director of the office, who stared at me and looked totally bored, like she resented having to interview anyone. She asked some generic questions that could have come from any interviewing book. The associate director sat behind her, and he didn't ask any questions, just wrote down my answers in a notebook. Strange an unprofessional interview.
Interview Questions: What is it like to live in New Jersey?

title: Research Coordinator/Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and I dealt with two senior employees that were directly involved with the research. I was asked about my experience in the specific modality that the study involved and I answered honestly, admitting that I had no formal training or experience in that specific modality. They were still willing to train me and take me on, giving me a more than fair shot at the job, regardless of my lack of experience.
Interview Questions: What research have you been involved with in the past?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: they asked basic questions about my knowledge in the field.  They asked me about my strengths and weaknesses. They described my daily responsibilities. And they offered me the position on the spot at the end of the interview. overall it was a very easy interview and i enjoyed the process throughly.  My supervisor was great. 50 words is a lot of words to write about this job. It was an entry level position that you did not need
Interview Questions: what are your weaknesses

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Skills assessment and culture fit, mostly. Questions were pretty easy to answer. They administered a couple tests to assess my skills. The first interview was with my supervisor and one other senior staff member, and the other was with the whole larger group that I would be working closely with.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The professor asked me questions about my background and what classes I had taken in the department. He mostly explained his research to me so that I could decide whether I had the relevant background to help with his research. In the end he made sure I didn't reveal anything about his research and explained the work I would be doing and how I could contribute.
Interview Questions: What classes have you taken in this department?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 weeks for the whole process. 3 rounds. 1st- write up, 2nd- phone, 3-In-person. The interviewers were kind and made the whole experience comfortable for me. The panel was young and I had a great time during the entire process. Then they explained me how the system worked and asked me if I had any questions for them.
Interview Questions: If you could change one thing about the way you approach challenges, what would it be?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for one GA through careernet and did not get the offer. However, the girl referred me to a different office and I worked there for a semester. Overall it was a good experience. I got to learn new programs and worked with clients and professors.
Interview Questions: How will your experience rely to this job

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview and ask very simple behavior questions. Ask me something about Excel skills and how to deal with students' not-satisfaction situation. A team interview and they are nice.
Interview Questions: Excel skill

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Applied. Invited for group on site interview. Process was fun at times, beautiful building and campus is easily accessible through the subway. Everyone was pretty honest, I really liked that. It would have been a nice place to work also considering the tuition benefits.
Interview Questions: How would you manage multiple people and projects with deadlines?

title: Master In Math In Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University)
Interview Descriptions: Apply online first, if you receive an offer elsewhere, make sure you send an email to NYU and ask them for an interview, they will typically reply to you in the next 2-3 days. 20-minute interview, interviewer is a senior manager at GS, mostly going over the resume, and ask you if you have any question, pretty easy and friendly environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: skype interview with chair and associate director, asked about teaching background as well as professional experience. also asked about why wanting this position and relocating from west coast. this was for one year lecture position
Interview Questions: how you balance teaching and creative work

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: An informal, non-technical chat with professor, asking you to talk about your relevant work experience, your philosophy about teaching, how confident you are about being a good TA etc etc. Master's students have a big disadvantage in competing with PhD level students for TA jobs, so they have to make better cases for themselves.
Interview Questions: What are some relevant teaching experiences you've had?

title: Assistant Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for a research assistant position at Wagner school of Public Policy. The interview was short. They needed somebody with very specific data management skills. The building is very nice and my interviewer was very courteous but straighforward. I has some of the skills they needed but was not a perfect fit for the position.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I had experience working with multi level models, random and fixed effects.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very good.  Learned a lot about the office and the work culture that they wanted. They gave me a tour around the office and also introduced me to all the people that worked their. I was very pleased and the people in the office and all that Jazz. I got recommended here so that's probably they went a little easy on me. I think that everyone should apply to this company. Please just let me go.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and didn't hear back from HR until almost a year later.  I received an email stating that they were setting up interviews and was given days and times that I could come in.  I replied back and had an interview a week later.  

The day of the interview I came in and had to call the person interviewing me so that someone could come get me by the elevators (who never showed up) but some random person walking past the doors let me in.  Once I arrived at the location I was greeted by the receptionist at the desk.  She let my interviewer know that i was here and she came out within 5 minutes.  She came with a few forms for me to fill out and offered me something to drink. After I filled out my forms I gave them back to the receptionist and went into the office about 2 minutes later.  Overall the interview took about 30-45 minutes.  It was a very relaxing interview.

After the interview it took about a month before I received a response about the job.  I knew it was going to be long before I received a response because I was notified in the beginning of the interview that this would be a long process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Resources Coordinator/Recruiting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I had quite a negative experience interviewing at NYU. The position was PT and temp and the interview process was obnoxious. 

One of the HR admins asked me to name a time I dealt with a difficult client and how I handled it but I never had a client so I thought that question was slightly odd. I elaborated all of my former professional experiences prior to the question being asked. Although I was slightly annoyed by the question because it was quite stupid in nature, I pleasantly stated once more that I never dealt with clients because being that I am 25 years old and have solely had administrative based experience, I have never had a client. She was insistent upon me answering the question and didn't really listen to what I was saying. The HR director also asked me if I have ever posted jobs in the local newspaper when working as a recruiting assistant in the corporate office for a retail store. I thought that was also a ludicrous question considering the positions were low level (sales associates, cashiers, store managers). I have never heard of someone posting a retail sales associate in the local paper but again, the entire interview process was an incredible waste of time and left me feeling irritated.

The HR director also was extremely sarcastic and kept joking as I answered each question which would disable me from getting my full answer across. I thought that was very unprofessional. 

It is more than fine if the HR team did not perceive me as a fit for the position but they should have not kept me in the process for 2 hours worth of time (over the course of two days). It overall felt like a colossal waste of time and I found them to be inappropriate as well as rude. I ended up not getting an offer which is fine because if they were to extend an offer, I would swiftly decline. I would rather be unemployed than work here.
Interview Questions:
How do you stay organized?

Name a time where you dealt with a client that was unhappy and how you handled it(good luck with this one if you've never had clients before!)

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and roughly a month later I was contacted via email to schedule a phone interview.  When the day of the phone interview came, I sat by my phone and waited for the recruiter to call.  She never called.  After that I reached out to the recruiter by both email and telephone to see what happened, and ended up rescheduling the interview.  

Now, one would think a recruiter who missed the first interview would not miss the rescheduled interview, right?  Wrong.  This recruiter totally did not call me on the scheduled day, but instead called me two days later.  Since I really needed the job I ended up doing the phone interview at the unscheduled time (which I should add was difficult because it was during a time I really couldn’t talk on the phone for an interview).  The phone interview questions were pretty basic.  They were things like: “Why do you want to work for NYU?”; “Tell me about your background.”; “What are your salary requirements?”; etc.  After the phone interview, I was asked to come in and do an in person interview.  I accepted and headed to NYU a week later for the interview.  

Overall, I would say the interview went ok.  A junior/mid level analyst interviewed me for the financial analyst position I applied to.  It was a one-on-one interview that lasted roughly 20 minutes.  I guess my biggest complaint about the interview was that the guy interviewing me didn’t seem to have a lot of experience conducting interviews.  He seemed nervous while talking to me and also seemed like he didn’t know what types of questions to ask me.  In fact, now that I think about it, a lot of the questions he asked seemed really random and totally unconnected to the position I was applying for.  I’ve been on a lot of other financial analyst interviews recently, and usually I am asked questions like “How do you handle budget inconsistencies?” or “What types of financial controls have you worked with in the past?”  This guy was asking things like “What class would you take if you could take any class?” and “Do you like to travel?”  In sum, very few of the questions I was asked were actually questions that would measure and determine my ability to perform the tasks of this position.  

Once I left the interview, I received a computer generated rejection email several weeks later letting me know I did not get the job.  There was no reason given as to why I did not get the job in the email.

Lastly, I want to mention one useful thing for others who may interview with NYU.  It seemed to me that NYU really emphasizes that you must have previous experience using their proprietary software.  I think this is completely unrealistic.  In my interview, I mentioned that while I didn’t have experience using their exact software, I have had experience and training using very similar software.  The interviewer seemed concerned that I didn’t have this exact experience.  Also, I was asked if I could use Excel during this interview.  This is such a dumb question, but one you should be prepared for.  I guess the point I’m trying to make here is that they are really, really picky about finding an exact match for the technical skills they’re looking for and they place significant value on having exact experience that matches the job duties.
Interview Questions: What class would you take at NYU if you could take any class here?

Ten minutes later, the HR director called me, rushed through the interview, and then told me I would hear back from them in about a week.  It's been two months and, clearly, I am no longer a candidate.  I am not terribly upset by this, as, thankfully, I have full time employment and am looking to make a career move, but I certainly feel for the people who put a lot of effort into a position with NYU only to be treated unprofessionally.

Met directly with the curator of the collection, not a hiring manager, who was easy going and focused on compatibility and experience.

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview

Interview Descriptions: They'll ask you the general on line questions. You have to be social and likeable. Someone who students and counselors can approach. Be very excited to be there. Act like it's hard to apply for a job there and that being a part of the university has always been something that you've wanted. Act like you're willing to do anything to be hired.

title: Student Worker Interview

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: IT Support Analyst Interview

title: Procurement Director Interview

Interview Descriptions: Application was sent in January, heard nothing for 2 months, then suddenly a request for a phone screening interview from HR.  I believe this person is a contractor, not a direct employee of NYU.  Was told I would hear from Hiring Manager if he was interested, but no time line was available.  Never heard anything back, almost 1 month later
Interview Questions: If you could have any job in the world, what would it be?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview

title: Student Worker Interview

title: Assistant Professor Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Oct 2011

The open position was for an Administrative Aid postion in the admissions office. Interview Questions: After explaining my passion for working in the field of higher ed and how my qualifications precisely meet their needs -- I was asked to give a 30 pitch on why they should choose me over other candidates. I didn't want to sound repetitive, but it kind of caught me off guard because it was the very last question asked.

title: Associate Director Global Health Interview

Interview Descriptions:

one-on-one interview with the executive director of NYU global division
Skills review based on resume
total interview process took two days
Recommendations requested from two previous employers

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Sept 2011

Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why we should hire you

title: Web Administrator Interview

Interview Descriptions:
simple questions:
1. What's difference between client side and server side.
2. What's softlink and hard link
3. What chmod do?
4. What is cgi how it works?
Interview Questions: How to transpose a matrix

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted a panel of two department managers who didn't possess good interviewing skills. Didn't get feed back about the position until six weeks after the interview. After contacting one of my panel interviewers every week for six weeks, I was contacted by the personnel department and this is where I underwent a behavioral interview. I was offered the position during the interview, informed that the position was a unionized position so the salary was set and non-negotiable.  I accepted the position and was given a start date for two weeks after that interview. So the entire process took eight week from initial interview to start date.
Interview Questions: Questions at initial interview were completely silly, didn't follow any interview formats I've ever encountered previously or since. At the subsequent interview I was asked what would former clients of my previous employer say was my best attribute.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process had a phone screening and then a half day event with several interviews in a row. A wide range of topics were touched. The interviews were very casual and involved quite a bit of small talk and chatting.
Interview Questions: What is a regression discontinuity design?

title: Assistant Director, Fiscal Affairs, Office of the Provost Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application with resume and cover letter in February 2011.  I was then contacted in mid-March for a phone interview for 30 minutes when I was asked a series of questions from the hiring manager.  I was then invited to a 1:1 in-person interview with the hiring manager for a 45 minute interview.  I was then asked to come back a couple weeks later for a series of interviews with 5 Directors and VP's which took a total of 2+hours.  I was then asked to come back the next day for a 1.5 hour Excel and Writing test to prove my skills (I have an MBA from NYU, the hiring school).  On the same day as the skills test, I had a conversation with the hiring manager during which time I asked for more detailed explanation of what my daily responsibilities would be, instead of answering the question, I was asked "Well are you going to take the job or not and if you do, are you gonna leave after 6 months which would bring us back to square 1."  Alarmed by the hostility, I simply answered "I am still very much interested in the position but not knowing what the salary or benefits are, I would really need more information to take all things under consideration."   I was then asked for 3 reference checks and after providing contact info for each, two and a half weeks later, I was told that my references would have to include my current manager even though I had not even received a job offer yet.  After expressing that I cannot allow NYU to contact my current manager without an offer of employment,  I was then emailed a job offer in May 2011 2+months after my initial phone interview in March 2011.  When I asked if the salary and start date were negotiable (10% increase of offer salary and 1 week later of start date), instead of being told that the terms were not negotiable, the job offer was completely rescinded without explanation but the hiring manager made sure that I knew that a hard copy of the "rescission letter" would be sent to my home via USPS even though what had been the offer letter had only been emailed to me (not mailed) just 3 days earlier.  I was never referred or given access to an HR PROFESSIONAL through this entire process.  The manager who I would have reported directly to if I got the job was my only point of contact for employment negotiations.  After taking 3 days out of my current job over the course of 2+months to interview with NYU and take excel/writing tests, I was given an offer of employment and 3 days later it was rescinded without explanation because I reasonably tried to negotiate my terms of employment.  I am an NYU alumnus with an MBA from the Stern School of Business.  I have never been treated with such disregard and have never wasted my time recruiting like this before.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: send your resume to professor's official email ID, have recommendation from somebody they know, if selected, appointment is scheduled, they ask you about your academic grades and experience, any previous job/projects and knowledge about their lab research. They screen for students who might stay longer as they don't have to train again and again.
Interview Questions: why you didn't score A's on all classes?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: hour interview in office.   Wonderful conversation. Love the NYU enthusiasm for learning.  Great employer.  Can't speak highly enough.    All it took was to have the right experience and training, the enthusiasm for the job, and a good contact with the human resources department.
Interview Questions: What kinds of courses can you teach?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed here in 2011.  Was strung along for two months and 5 interviews for two different positions.  At the end of it all, they didn't even have the decency to inform me of their decision- I had to call the office numerous to get a hold of the HR manager who was dodging my calls.
Interview Questions: They put you into a scenario where you are trying to get a high dollar donor to give money to the university.  You play the development person and they play the donor.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Mar 2011

title: Director Interview

Interview Descriptions: It took nearly six months from application to hire date! Typical of a large decentralized organization.  I had three meetings over four months, and it took an additional 6 weeks to get an offer.

title: Administrative Aide Interview

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions: Had good time talking to the group and the supervisor. Typical interview as any other postdoc positions. The outcoming depends mostly on the chemistry between yourself and the supervisor. For postdocs, your resume mostly determines if you'll get the job even before you go in for on-site interview to meet and talk to the people.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

title: Investment Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume and called to follow up. I was granted a phone interview. I was asked specific questions on investment strategy and compensation. We also discussed investing in a higher education setting relative to with a traditional asset management firm.
Interview Questions: Describe your ideal asset allocation.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied for unsolicited position by emailing PI.  I was contacted immediately and told that a position might be available in 2-3 months after a grant was reviewed.  When the grant was awarded I was contacted to set up a skype interview followed by an in person interview.  It was a typical postdoc interview process:  Meet with PI for about an hour.   Gave a 1 hour talk about my research.  Met the lab members for 15-20 minutes each.  Went to lunch with a few other postdocs.  Had meetings with a couple other faculty members.  Went out to dinner with the whole lab.  The next day a joined again for their lab meeting.
Interview Questions: It was a very casual interview and I never got any unexpected questions.

title: Research Scientist Interview

There was a back and forth of both sides asking questions and giving answers.

title: Human Resources Administrator Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

When we met for our formal interview, I completed a typing test and then discussed my long term goals. The recruiter then shuffled thru the available positions and found a research opportunity and called the manager on the spot for an interview. The same day I met with my position supervisor and interviewed with him. I was offered the job the next day and started work the following week.

Overall it was a relatively relaxed experience and as much of a recruitment effort as an interview.  There was a pressing need to fill the position.

Experience with supervising others.

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU (New York University) (New York, NY) in Aug 2007
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by phone to see if they wanted to bring me in -- this initial interview was intense and they asked a lot of questions like What was the hardest thing you ever had to deal with at work, how did you resolve it, etc.  When I was brought in for live interviewing, they it was also really intense, and they posed a series of questions that basically tested my morals.  For instance, she asked me what I would do if I found out one of my friends was going to put a downpayment on a house, but I knew from a friend in HR that she was going to be laid off.  They hire less than one percent of online applicants, so they really do a good job of weeding out.
Interview Questions: What is the one thing your past employer would say that you could improve?
